name: Time After Time cowl
description: Time after Time cowl is soft & squishy and features a slip stitch rib pattern that looks great on either side. It uses super bulky weight yarn and includes instructions for 2 sizes: a 2-color long, infinity style (although you could use 2 skeins of 1 color if you prefer) and a 1-color short, neck warmer style.
full_text: Time after Time cowl is soft & squishy and features a slip stitch rib pattern that looks great on either side. It uses super bulky weight yarn and includes instructions for 2 sizes: a 2-color long, infinity style (although you could use 2 skeins of 1 color if you prefer) and a 1-color short, neck warmer style. Fast & fun, Time after Time is an enjoyable, relaxing knit and makes a great gift-making project for all knitting levels. Pattern is available for free as my holiday gift to you! Check out my Time after Time tips page for: info/tips on how to adjust pattern for different gauges tips about working the stitch pattern other technique tutorials PATTERN DETAILS: Finished Measurements: Long Version: 57”/145 cm circumference x 7”/18 cm height Short Version: 26.75”/68 cm circumference x 7”/18 cm height Yarn: Super Bulky weight yarn, shown in Super Bulky by Hedgehog Fibres (100% merino wool; 150g = 89 yds). Quantities listed below: Long Version: 89 yds each of 2 colors (178 yds total), shown in Kelp (color A, 1 skein) and Liebling (color B, 1 skein). Short Version: 89 yds of 1 color, shown in Plume (1 skein). Gauge: 9 sts & 14 rnds = 4”/10 cm in st pattern Exact gauge is not critical but it will affect your finished measurement and yarn usage. Needles & Other Supplies: Long Version: US 15/10 mm 32”/80 cm circ, or size needed to obtain gauge. Short Version: US 15/10 mm 24”/60 cm circ, or size needed to obtain gauge. 1 stitch marker. Tapestry needle to weave in ends.
